Key Match Events: Jack Grealish scored the first goal in the 18th minute
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored with a free kick in the 74th minute
Declan Rice scored with a tap-in in the 84th minute
Arttu Hoskonen pulled one back for Finland with an 87th minute header
Pre-Game Insights: England's interim manager Lee Carsley made six changes from the shambolic 2-1 defeat by Greece at Wembley
England returned to a more conventional formation after Carsley's experimental lineup without a main striker against the Greeks failed miserably
Post-Match Reflections: Grealish said the goal came from the manager letting them play with freedom
Rice said he arrived at the ball after making a bursting run from midfield
Grealish celebrated his goal with a thumb-sucking gesture to celebrate the birth of his daughter last month
Carsley has faced scrutiny since the loss, his first since Gareth Southgate stood down as England manager after Euro 2024
Miscellaneous Highlights: England enjoyed a 3-1 win over Finland thanks to goals from Jack Grealish, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Declan Rice
England are second in Group B2 with nine points after four games, level on points with leaders Greece who host Ireland later on Sunday
Finland will regret missing chances when England led 1-0, including two from Fredrik Jensen who fired just wide in the first-half and missed a sitter early in the second
Others: The match was played at the Helsinki Olympic Stadium in front of 32,411 fans
